claim.claim_preamble: An implantable cardiac rhythm management system

claim.body: the heart sound processor further comprises a measurement timer configured to time predetermined measurement sessions and predetermined measurement periods each including a plurality of the predetermined measurement sessions, the ratio calculator is configured to calculate an S3 session ratio being a ratio of a number of the S3 beats counted during one of the predetermined measurement sessions to the number of the heart beats counted during that one of the predetermined measurement sessions, and the heart sound analyzer further comprises an averaging module configured to calculate an average of the S3 session ratios for one of the predetermined measurement periods.
claim.claim-text: 2. The system of claim 1 , wherein the heart sound processor further comprises a measurement timer configured to time predetermined measurement sessions and predetermined measurement periods each including a plurality of the predetermined measurement sessions, the ratio calculator is configured to calculate an S3 session ratio being a ratio of a number of the S3 beats counted during one of the predetermined measurement sessions to the number of the heart beats counted during that one of the predetermined measurement sessions, and the heart sound analyzer further comprises an averaging module configured to calculate an average of the S3 session ratios for one of the predetermined measurement periods.

claim.body: the heart sound analyzer further comprises a trend generator adapted to generate a trend of the S3 index as a moving average of the S3 session ratios over the predetermined measurement periods.
claim.claim-text: 3. The system of claim 2 , wherein the heart sound analyzer further comprises a trend generator adapted to generate a trend of the S3 index as a moving average of the S3 session ratios over the predetermined measurement periods.

claim.body: the heart sound detector is configured to improve a signal-to-noise ratio of the acoustic signal by ensemble averaging.
claim.claim-text: 4. The system of claim 1 , wherein the heart sound detector is configured to improve a signal-to-noise ratio of the acoustic signal by ensemble averaging.

claim.body: the heart sound detector further comprises: a measurement module to detect an acoustic energy using the acoustic signal; and an S3 threshold generator adapted to determine the S3 threshold based on the acoustic energy.
claim.claim-text: 6. The system of claim 5 , wherein the heart sound detector further comprises: a measurement module to detect an acoustic energy using the acoustic signal; and an S3 threshold generator adapted to determine the S3 threshold based on the acoustic energy.

claim.body: the heart sound detector further comprises an S3 threshold generator configured to dynamically adjust the S3 threshold based on an estimated background sound level (μ B ) measured during a predetermined period between an occurrence of S1 and an adjacent occurrence of S2.
claim.claim-text: 7. The system of claim 5 , wherein the heart sound detector further comprises an S3 threshold generator configured to dynamically adjust the S3 threshold based on an estimated background sound level (μ B ) measured during a predetermined period between an occurrence of S1 and an adjacent occurrence of S2.

claim.body: the S3 threshold generator comprises an S3 threshold calculator configured to calculate the S3 threshold as μ B *K, where K is an adjustable multiplier.
claim.claim-text: 8. The system of claim 7 , wherein the S3 threshold generator comprises an S3 threshold calculator configured to calculate the S3 threshold as μ B *K, where K is an adjustable multiplier.

claim.body: the hermetically sealed can further houses the acoustic sensor.
claim.claim-text: 9. The system of claim 1 , wherein the hermetically sealed can further houses the acoustic sensor.

claim.body: the implantable acoustic sensor comprises an implantable accelerometer.
claim.claim-text: 10. The system of claim 9 , wherein the implantable acoustic sensor comprises an implantable accelerometer.
